text: There isn’t… out of curiosity, what would you expect it to output? Pages use the default module and dnd_area render behaviors and don’t automatically have a rich text area in the data model by default the way a blog post does.

thanks for your reply, Mark!

I was looking to do something similar to <https://github.com/ericsalvi/Add-Reading-Minutes-to-Blog-Posts>

some of our long-form content are on web pages instead of the blog

got it. I could see something like that working, but instead of just using `content.post_body` you’d need a wordcount for all the modules in your page body. So something like set a variable called `page_word_count` to 0, and for every module in the primary drag-and-drop area, if the module includes text get the wordcount for that module and add it to `page_word_count`. Then feed that number to the function in the same way as the repo you shared.
